benchmark_details.name: XferBench
benchmark_details.overview: XferBench is a data-driven benchmark for evaluating the overall quality of emergent languages using transfer learning with deep neural models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the quality of emergent language corpora based on their transfer learning performance on human languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The model and data size are limited, potentially affecting applicability to larger contemporary problems.

data.size: 15 million tokens for pretraining and 2 million tokens for fine-tuning

methodology.calculation: The benchmark score is derived from the arithmetic mean of cross-entropy across multiple downstream human languages.
methodology.validation: Validation is based on cross-entropy performance on test sets of human languages.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is used under GFDL and CC-BY-SA 3.0 License.
